DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Immunoglobulin Replacement Therapy Timepoint Transplantation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether an individual was on chronic immunoglobulin replacement therapy at the time of bone marrow transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Immunoglobulin Replacement Therapy Timepoint Transplantation Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._Any of the structurally related glycoproteins that function as antibodies. They are divided into five classes (IGA, IGD, IGE, IGG, IGM) on the basis of structure and biological activity._Administration of a body substance to compensate for the loss, as from disease or surgery, of a gland or tissue that would normally produce the substance._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.:Any of the structurally related glycoproteins that function as antibodies. They are divided into five classes (IGA, IGD, IGE, IGG, IGM) on the basis of structure and biological activity.:Administration of a body substance to compensate for the loss, as from disease or surgery, of a gland or tissue that would normally produce the substance.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
Any of the structurally related glycoproteins that function as antibodies. They are divided into five classes (IGA, IGD, IGE, IGG, IGM) on the basis of structure and biological activity.
Administration of a body substance to compensate for the loss, as from disease or surgery, of a gland or tissue that would normally produce the substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR Primary Immunosuppression CRF template.10.21.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
